intro: Echinocactus lecontei var. albispinus, commonly known as the white-spined hedgehog cactus, is a succulent native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems covered in white spines, which provide protection from herbivores and intense sunlight. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, adding a striking contrast to its spiny appearance. Its succulent nature allows it to store water efficiently, making it well adapted to dry environments. The variety albispinus is distinguished by its particularly dense and pale spines, setting it apart from other members of the Echinocactus genus.
